definition: to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
to forget/to overlook/to neglect
to return (to)

sentences.english: Toward the Qin Shi, the number of people who proudly interest, flocked to forget.
sentences.chinese: 向着石琴，多少人兴致昂然，络绎不绝，流连忘返。

sentences.english: Additionally, various books and magazines are available for your convenience, making you enjoy your waiting time.
sentences.chinese: 另配各类书籍杂志，让等候也变得流连忘返。

sentences.english: I got carried away in Dean & DeLuca last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我在迪安和德鲁卡的食品杂货店流连忘返。

sentences.english: The fragrance of extending paddy fields makes foreign tourists linger on and forget to return.
sentences.chinese: 千亩稻田香两岸，令人流连忘返。

sentences.english: Haunted by monkeys and by deer.
Dreams lingered by my side long.
sentences.chinese: 梦想萦绕身边流连忘返。

sentences.english: Both diffuse hard to forget, but also dense with people narcissism.
sentences.chinese: 既能弥漫的让人流连忘返，又能氤氲着使人自我陶醉。

sentences.english: They are dancers, their street dance impressed us deeply.
sentences.chinese: 他们的街舞让大家流连忘返。

sentences.english: When we come to the beach, blue sea that makes us linger.
sentences.chinese: 当我们来到海边，那蔚蓝的海洋会让我们流连忘返。

sentences.english: The West Lake in Hangchow is a magnet for visitors.
sentences.chinese: 杭州西湖使游客流连忘返。

sentences.english: The young man who is enchanted by the night scene does not want to go home.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人被这夜景所吸引而流连忘返。

sentences.english: Spiritual and material gain, so that people forget fishing.
sentences.chinese: 精神与物质的收获，让钓鱼人流连忘返。

sentences.english: He is a nighthawk, always hanging around in the night clubs.
sentences.chinese: 他是个夜游神，常在夜总会流连忘返。

sentences.english: Yeah, I visited there after work.It really lets me forget to return.
sentences.chinese: 恩，我下班后去的，它真让我流连忘返。

sentences.english: When we come to the beach, azure sea that makes us linger.
sentences.chinese: 当我们来到海边，那湛蓝的海洋会让我们流连忘返。

sentences.english: Truly the boss assured profit, smooth players happy to play away.
sentences.chinese: 真正做到老板放心赢利，玩家开心畅玩，流连忘返。

definition: one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
(of scenery) stunning/spectacular/picturesque
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
enchanted/fascinated/charmed
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to miss/to yearn day and night
ecstatic/enraptured
beautiful scenery
to become intoxicated
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
to be captivated/to wonder/enchanting
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
(of houses, scenery etc) magnificent (idiom)
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
